latex: A line in the plane is called \textit{strange} if it passes through $(a,0)$ and $(0,10-a)$ for some $a$ in the interval $[0,10]$.  A point in the plane is called \textit{charming} if it lies in the first quadrant and also lies \textbf{below} some strange line.  What is the area of the set of all charming points?
